J

Job - Class in <Unnamed>
Job.java Job implements a basic construct for jobs in the context of operating systems.
Job(int, int, int) - Constructor for class Job
Constructor generates a new job (process) based on three integer arguments.
Job() - Constructor for class Job
Default constructor generates a new job (process), initializing every attribute of the job to -1.
JobNotInMemoryException - Class in <Unnamed>
JobNotInMemoryException.java Is thrown when attempting to deallocate a job from memory and the specified job does not exist in memory.
JobNotInMemoryException() - Constructor for class JobNotInMemoryException
 
JobQueue - Class in <Unnamed>
 
JobQueue() - Constructor for class JobQueue
The default constructor creates a new, empty job queue to a capacity of NUM_JOBS field in HOS.java.
JobQueueFullException - Class in <Unnamed>
JobQueueFullException.java Is thrown when attempting to add a job when the job queue is full.
JobQueueFullException() - Constructor for class JobQueueFullException
 
JobStatus - Enum in <Unnamed>
JobStatus.java JobStatus is a public enumeration of the several statuses that a job (in the context of an operating system) might be in at any point in time.

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class HOS
Entry point of the Hypothetical Operating System simulation.
mallocBF(Job) - Method in class Memory
Tries to allocate a given job to memory according to the "Best-Fit" allocation strategy.
mallocFF(Job) - Method in class Memory
Tries to allocate a given job to memory according to the "First-Fit" allocation strategy.
